intro: Aporosa nervosa, commonly known as the veined aporosa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. Aporosa nervosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
